context: The Estonian adjective 'lühike' means short or brief and has multiple related meanings: 1) referring to physical length/height (short person, dress, etc.), 2) referring to duration/time (short summer night, short life), 3) being concise in speech/writing (short answer, brief article), 4) sudden/jerky movement, and 5) limited/lacking understanding. It's an inflected adjective with various forms including lühikese (genitive), lühikest (partitive), lühem (comparative), and kõige lühem or lühim (superlative).
